Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?

A) The study is a non-research clinical trial.
B) The study is a routine medical procedure.
C) The study is a research project investigating a treatment for oral cancer.
D) The study is a commercial product trial for Antitumor B.

Correct answer: C) The study is a research project investigating a treatment for oral cancer.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the research study involving Antitumor B (ATB) in patients with oral cancer?
A) To compare the effectiveness of ATB with standard chemotherapy treatments; B) To establish the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of ATB; C) To assess the long-term survival rates of patients taking ATB; D) To determine the best surgical techniques for oral cancer treatment

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of participation for a subject in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B study?
A) 4 weeks; B) 6 weeks; C) 8 weeks; D) 12 weeks
Correct answer: B) 6 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the costs incurred by participating in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?

A) Participants will be responsible for all medical costs associated with the study, including the study compound ATB.
B) Participants will receive compensation for all medical and travel expenses related to the study.
C) Certain study-related costs, such as the study compound ATB and research sample processing, will not be billed to participants or their insurance.
D) Insurance companies are required to cover all costs of the study, including any emergency treatment related to research injuries.

Correct answer: C) Certain study-related costs, such as the study compound ATB and research sample processing, will not be billed to participants or their insurance.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
How long will participants be required to stay in the clinic after taking the study compound on the first day of treatment?
A) 1 hour
B) 4 hours
C) 8 hours
D) 24 hours

Correct answer: C) 8 hours

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What are the implications if you choose to withdraw from the PK Analysis of Antitumor B study?
A) You will be required to continue the study treatments without any medical supervision; B) Your regular medical care will be discontinued; C) Your decision to withdraw will not affect your regular medical care; D) You will be obligated to reimburse the cost of the study treatments received up to that point.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is considered experimental in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?
A) Routine blood tests such as CBC with Differential and Platelet Count
B) Administration of the study compound Antitumor B (ATB) for 7-28 days prior to surgery
C) Standard tumor biopsies performed as part of oral cancer diagnosis
D) Physical exams and medical history reviews

Correct answer: B

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study at the Medical College of Wisconsin/Froedtert Hospital?
A) 5; B) 8; C) 12; D) 20
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk associated with participating in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?
A) Temporary hair loss; B) Elevated liver enzymes; C) Increased risk of common cold; D) Severe allergic reactions to anesthesia

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What potential benefits are associated with participating in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?
A) Guaranteed improvement in the participant's oral cancer condition
B) Direct financial compensation for participation
C) Potential contribution to the development of better treatments for oral cancer in the future
D) Assurance of receiving a new, FDA-approved treatment for oral cancer

Correct answer: C

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your personal health information will be protected in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?
A) Your personal health information will be shared publicly to help with the study's promotion.
B) Your personal health information will be kept confidential, with access limited to the research team and certain regulatory agencies.
C) All your health information will be accessible to any interested party without restrictions.
D) Your personal health information will be disclosed to all participants in the study for comparison purposes.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a direct result of participating in the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation for emergency treatment?
A) The costs of emergency treatment will be fully covered by the research study.
B) You or your health insurance will be billed for the costs of emergency treatment, and MCW will decide on a case-by-case basis if they will reimburse you or your insurer for these costs.
C) You will receive a fixed financial compensation for any injury, regardless of the treatment costs.
D) The study will provide free ongoing treatment for any injuries sustained during the study.

Correct answer: B) You or your health insurance will be billed for the costs of emergency treatment, and MCW will decide on a case-by-case basis if they will reimburse you or your insurer for these costs.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your ability to withdraw from the PK Analysis of Antitumor B in Patients with Oral Cancer study?

A) Withdrawing from the study will result in a penalty.
B) You may withdraw at any time without any impact on your regular medical care.
C) Refusal to participate will result in loss of benefits you are entitled to.
D) You are obligated to complete the study once you agree to participate.

Correct answer: B) You may withdraw at any time without any impact on your regular medical care.
